content: They’re offering a kick boxing course that includes cardio boxing at the gym. I’ve kicked a few azzes and had my azz kicked a few times so I’m thinking why not take the course. At 60 and ½ years of age it’ll be good exercise if I can keep up. I figure I have two options, survive the course or be toted off in an ambulance. If you don’t hear from me in the future I didn’t make it or if I survive check the illness thread, I’ll post from the hospital.

content: At sixty you can't afford any kind of azz kicking Been there, Done that and I have the shots to prove it.

title: Kick Boxing

content: Anything you feel healthy enough to do, give it a try at a cautious pace... My son went through two operations for a broken back and was told all the usual "You'll never again be able to..." crap. He believed it for a while, but then read up on Bruce Lee - - Tai Quondo, Karate, and Kung Fu later (Black Belts in all three) he now is a SWAT Team Cop and hand-to-hand instructor for the Law Enforcement College... My only regret is that I didn't take the classes with him!! Wandering and Wondering

content: My son Jess has a black belt in kind of Karate as well. I’m in fair shape for my age because I exercise and push a few weights at the gym. Really I’m taking it more for the cardio than self defense; I carry Mr. Colt for that. Tonio you’re right about the azz whipping so I’ll cheat if necessary. GW to bad you live so far away I’d try and get you to take it with me.

title: Kick Boxing

content: At 60, you should probably have a good medical workup first to make sure that you're in good enough shape and that your bones are strong enough for it! Alternatively, since you say it's mostly for cardio, have you considered Tai-chi; at least as a starting point to work up to the more strenuous disciplines? Just a thought! When I worked our local EMS, I saw more than a few people in our age group (granted, they could have been in better overall health) who quite literally broke bones and dislocated joints sneezing! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine

content: You'll love it, Terry. I have been in Krav Maga, Kenpo and Kendo since I was 18. But like others have opined, get a checkup first, bro. Any martial art is demanding, and you never really know what's under your skin just waiting to cause you issues. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
reply: You'll love it, Terry. I have been in Krav Maga, Kenpo and Kendo since I was 18. But like others have opined, get a checkup first, bro. Any martial art is demanding, and you never really know what's under your skin just waiting to cause you issues. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
title: Kick Boxing

content: I’ll remember that Kim and try not to sneeze during practice. Heh Heh I used to teach scuba (PADI instructor # 4366) and still dive. This past summer a guy started talking with me in the keys and said he wanted to spear some fish at a spot he and some buddies found at 100 feet but they had left and he didn’t want to dive alone. I told him he could go with me. Once we got to the spot it took him forever to get ready so I waited in the water for him, I decided to go down, it was 110 feet. Waited, waited, waited, and went back up because you only have 20 minutes at 100 feet without decompressing. He was in a mess. He was behind the boat, had dropped his knife and spear gun and was having trouble swimming against the current to the anchor rope. I said lets go down here and we’ll get your stuff and swim toward the anchor once on the bottom. Our time on the bottom was spent finding his stuff and getting him back in order so we got no fish. When we were back on the boat he told Sharon, “I thought I’d be taking care of this guy but he swam circles around me”. A lot of folks would disagree with you about the azz part Don, most folk’s say “THAT’S ALL I AM”. Anyway we’ll see how the kick boxing thing goes. I think they have oxygen at the gym should I need it.

I told him he could go with me. Once we got to the spot it took him forever to get ready so I waited in the water for him, I decided to go down, it was 110 feet. Waited, waited, waited, and went back up because you only have 20 minutes at 100 feet without decompressing. He was in a mess. He was behind the boat, had dropped his knife and spear gun and was having trouble swimming against the current to the anchor rope. I said lets go down here and we’ll get your stuff and swim toward the anchor once on the bottom. Our time on the bottom was spent finding his stuff and getting him back in order so we got no fish. When we were back on the boat he told Sharon, “I thought I’d be taking care of this guy but he swam circles around me”. A lot of folks would disagree with you about the azz part Don, most folk’s say “THAT’S ALL I AM”. Anyway we’ll see how the kick boxing thing goes. I think they have oxygen at the gym should I need it.
